qas.question: Which monarch was responsible for dissolving parliament in 1629?
What is one action this monarch took that is typically left to the discretion of parliament?
After which event was it decided that parliament should meet on a regular basis?
Like Charles II had previously done, the last Stuart monarch withheld assent. Who was this monarch?
What did motions attempt to accomplish that prompted Charles I to dissolve parliament in 1629?

answers.text: restrict his arbitrary exercise of power

qas.question: When was the last time royal assent was enacted?
Who was the last monarch to use the royal assent in 1708?
Under whose advice did Anne withold the royal assent?
The power of parliament to pass bills was often supported by whom?
Charles I performed legally legitimate what?
Who raised taxes with parliament's approval?
The first Stuart monarch, Anne, did not withhold on what date?

context: The power of parliament to pass bills was often thwarted by <b9_0>monarchs<b9_0/>. <a0_0><a4_0><b11_0><b12_0>Charles I<b12_0/><b11_0/><a4_0/><a0_0/> dissolved parliament in 1629, after it passed motions critical of and bills seeking to <a5_0>restrict his arbitrary exercise of power<a5_0/>. During the eleven years of personal rule that followed, Charles performed legally dubious <b10_0>actions<b10_0/>, such as <a1_0>raising taxes<a1_0/> without parliament's approval. After the <a2_0>English Civil War<a2_0/>, it was accepted that parliament should be summoned to meet regularly, but it was still commonplace for monarchs to refuse royal assent to bills. In 1678, Charles II withheld his assent from a bill "for preserving the Peace of the Kingdom by raising the Militia, and continuing them in Duty for Two and Forty Days," suggesting that he, not parliament, should control the militia. The last Stuart monarch, <a3_0><a7_0>Anne<a7_0/><a3_0/>, similarly withheld on <a6_0><b13_0>11 March 1708<b13_0/><a6_0/>, on the advice of <a8_0>her ministers<a8_0/>, her assent from a bill for the settling of Militia in Scotland. No monarch has since withheld royal assent on a bill passed by the British parliament.
